item.description: By: John Shepler The concept of “Bring Your Own Device” (BYOD) can be a real headache for IT managers. While employees may enjoy the convenience, it poses a significant risk to a company’s sensitive data. When personal devices connect to the company network, carefully constructed security protocols are often bypassed. So, what can be done? Many companies address this issue by drawing a hard line. Recognizing the challenges of managing diverse personal devices, they prohibit their use for business purposes altogether.
